title: Further cover of Rwanda president casting ballot
description:
(4 Aug 2017) Rwandan President Paul Kagame has cast his vote in the country's presidential election, in which he is widely expected to win.
Kagame gave no public remarks after voting at a primary school on Friday.
Having won the 2010 election with 93 percent of the vote, he told a rally in July that "the day of the presidential elections will just be a formality."
He is running against Frank Habineza of the Democratic Green Party of Rwanda - the only permitted opposition party - and independent candidate Philippe Mpayimana.
There were long lines at polling stations in some parts of the capital, Kigali. 
Mpayimana and Habineza voted in other locations in the capital.
At some polling stations, music urged voters to choose the candidate who will transform the country and unite all Rwandans.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/b500f13151fefea41a48ad343fe40a9f 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork
